title: How to Evolve Your Charcadet in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet

steps.title: Catch a Charcadet.
steps.content: Catch a Charcadet. Charcadet can be caught in most of southern, eastern, and western Paldea. [1] X Research source You can find Charcadet in the following areas: South Province : Area Three, Area Four, Area Five East Province : Area One, Area Two, Area Three, Tagtree Thicket West Province : Area One, Area Two, Area Three, Asado Desert

steps.title: Go to Zapapico.
steps.content: Go to Zapapico. An NPC in Zapapico (a man in Pokémon Scarlet or a woman in Pokémon Violet) will trade an item you can use to evolve Charcadet.

steps.title: Talk to the NPC by the fountain near the eastern Pokémon Center.
steps.content: Talk to the NPC by the fountain near the eastern Pokémon Center. This NPC will trade you an item for either 10 Bronzor Fragments in Pokémon Scarlet [2] X Research source or 10 Sinistea Chips in Pokémon Violet. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Obtain the Bronzor Fragments or Sinistea Chips.
steps.content: Obtain the Bronzor Fragments or Sinistea Chips. You can get these items by defeating certain Pokémon: Bronzor Fragments : Defeat Bronzor (found in South Province Area Two, Area Three, Area Four and Area Five, East Province Area Two, and West Province Area One and Area Two) or Bronzong (South Province Area Six and North Province Area Two, Casseroya Lake, Dalizapa Passage or Glaseado Mountain) Sinistea Chips : Defeat Sinistea (found in South Province Area Six or East Province Area Three) or Polteageist (only found in 4- and 5-star Tera Raid Battles)

steps.title: Trade the Bronzor Fragments (Scarlet) or Sinistea Chips (Violet) with the NPC.
steps.content: Trade the Bronzor Fragments (Scarlet) or Sinistea Chips (Violet) with the NPC. In Pokémon Scarlet you'll get the Auspicious Armor and in Pokémon Violet you'll get the Malicious Armor. You can trade with this NPC multiple times as long as you have enough Bronzor Fragments or Sinistea Chips.

steps.title: Give the Armor to your Charcadet.
steps.content: Give the Armor to your Charcadet. In Pokémon Scarlet, Charcadet will evolve into Armarouge, and in Pokémon Violet it will evolve into Ceruledge. If you want to get an Armarouge in Pokémon Violet or a Ceruledge in Pokémon Scarlet, you'll need to trade with a friend. Your friend can either trade you the evolved Armarouge or Ceruledge, or trade you a Pokémon holding the Auspicious Armor or Malicious Armor.
